page.title: 01West New Deer Parish
page.content: Brucehill lies in the centre of this farming area which stretches down to the{Little Water}at{Allathan. { Allathan}is a corruption of the {Gaelic}place-name{'Alt-na-Ythan'}which means "the head of a tributary of the Ythan". The{Little Water}is also known as the{Black Water of Gight}(pronounced 'gicht') and runs into the{Ythan}near Methlick. The B 9170 runs through the area leading to Cuminestown and roads lead off to Cairnbanno, Greens and New Byth. The road to New Byth runs over the {Red Hill}so called because of the colour of its soil.
